verb.description: Raise (one's shoulders) slightly and momentarily to express doubt, ignorance, or indifference.
examples: Jimmy looked inquiringly at Pete, who shrugged his shoulders
he just shrugged and didn't look interested

noun.description: An act or instance of shrugging one's shoulders.
examples: she gave him a dismissive shrug

noun.description: A woman's close-fitting cardigan or jacket, cut short at the front and back so that only the arms and shoulders are covered.

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense fidget): of unknown origin.
